intro: Dalechampia galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
